questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 for Sales.
You need to change the description field on the quote.
Which state allows you to make the change?

discussion.content: On exam 27/4/22. Passed. I selected same answer

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A customer places an order that includes all of the products from a previous order. You plan to add products from the previous order to the new order.
From where can you retrieve the list of products? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Tested it and, if we are retrieving the products by the command bar button "Get Products" then the answer is "Opportunity" for all 3. If it's by creating a new record, then I would say the given answers are correct.

STEP ONE: create QUOTE "get product from previous opportunity"
STEP TWO: Create ORDER ( automatically gets its products from the "QUOTE" )
STEP THREE: Create INVOICE (automatically gets its products from the "ORDER")
i feel its correct

I feel the answer is correct and would not be appropriate to use " get Products" for Order and Invoice (should only be used on Quote entity to get products from prev order's Opportunity) as:
Question only talks about adding product from prev order, but after that there might be price, qty and discount changes required, which if done at Quote level, same needs to be carry forwarded to Order and Invoice (which might be additional effort if directly adding products on Order and Invoice level).
Given answers are correct. Tested this.

Opportunity for all three options. 

On this link >> https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/sales/add-products-qoi-enhanced << it says: "The process of adding a product to a quote is the same as adding a product to an order or an invoice. This procedure explains how to add products to a quote."

Opportunity for all 3.
Tested on all 3 Quotes, Orders, and Invoices. Get products from a previously created opportunity. Underneath it, there is only an Opportunity available.

I find myself leaning towards Opportunity for all 3 as well based off 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/sales/add-product-quote-order-invoice
"The process for adding a product to a quote record is the same as adding a product to an order or an invoice."
followed by 
"To add products from an opportunity, select the More commands button > Get products and select the opportunity.
Products from the selected opportunity are added to the quote."
I see no mention of anything other than opportunity in terms of this method to add products from a related record. Unfortunately I do not currently have quick access to an environment to validate this.
Supposing there was an opportunity for the previous order, you can create new quote, order, or invoice, click 'get product', and pick products from that opportunity

comments.content: Can you please provide some proof?

The questions clearly says the user get records from previous order not the same flow. 
i guess answer for all 3 is Opportunity

Because given the description of the question we have, it can be really the simplest logical answer with the sales process sequence. And since we are creating Order from a Quote, and an Invoice from an Order then (as for a user) it looks like I retrieve products from the screen where I creating the next record and from this perspective the given answers are looking correct.

discussion.content: No it isnt, the Products are fetched from the Opprotunities for all of them

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You use Dynamics 365 Sales.
You need to add products to an invoice.
Which options should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: A good link explaining the differences between kits and bundles: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/developer/create-manage-product-families-products-bundles-product-properties#differences-between-kits-and-bundles
On the exam 12.04.2021 there was this question, but instead of kit there was the option "products family".

I can't see Kit anymore in D365 Sales, correct me if wrong. Probably replaced by product family.
In that case, 1. Bundle, 2. Product family and 3. Product family.

Correct answer
Kits Bundles
All the products in a kit are mandatory. Some products in a bundle can be optional.
Kits support nesting; you can add a kit to another kit. You can’t add a bundle to another bundle. You can only add products to a bundle.

1. Bundle -- looks like product, but contains some grouping.
2. Family -- I can have the logical grouping and sell products individually. Why should I create any bundles if I sell products individually?
3. Family -- supports nesting.

1.-- BUNDLE(can add only prod to bundle)
2. Bundle(prod in bundle are optional; can see both bundle and prod level details)
3. KIT/PROD FAMILY(all prods in a kit are mandatory; kits support nesting;you can only see kit level details not ind. prod)

1.-- BUNDLE(can add only prod to bundle)
2. Bundle(prod in bundle are optional; can see both bundle and prod level details)
3. KIT/PROD FAMILY(all prods in a kit are mandatory; kits support nesting;you can only see kit level details not ind. prod)
Correct answer. Kits support nesting structures, therefore, 3rd Q = Kit. Follow the link above

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You use Dynamics 365 for Sales system customizer.
You need to create product kits and bundles.
What should you create? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A customer recently visited one of your retail outlets. You created an opportunity for the customer for a large purchase.
The customer is now ready to complete the purchase.
You need to create a quote from the opportunity.
Solution: On the Quotes tab of the opportunity, select Add New Quote.
Does the solution meet the goal?
